Nice job.
[/quote]

Older? So after RSC but before 414~[/quote]
Well yeah, some people find 525 old so… :P. Okay between 194 and 414.

item.title: Old Runescape File Hash Cracker
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Wintercanon:

Nice work sinisoul. Just wondering, how much does the vary from the RuneScape username hashing in the older engine?

Quite a bit, I don’t remember the new hash computation exactly but eh. Having trouble with this now because in the client it nerfs the value because the hash is only allotted to be an integer. I don’t think there is a way to fix this either.

Read full topic

item.title: Old Runescape File Hash Cracker
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:7, topic:423015”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=525677.msg3827448#msg3827448 date=1322291179]

What does this even do?

The old cache file system, in index 0, contained files with hashed names. This reverses that hash into the actual name of the file. I

How is that helpful? We don’t have the files so so what if we have the names? (Not trying to be an ass I’m actually asking)

“so so what” lol

You don’t have to brute the hashes if you ever wanted to get the files? Or if there are files in the cache that aren’t used by the client, you can actually see as to what they are named??

But don’t most clients have the necessary files already?
[/quote]

You are missing the point. I actually started this project tonight because I don’t want to have to load the files from a list in order to dump them and would rather just unhash it and then save the file. Its just a helpful code snippet if ever needed.[/quote]

That makes sense I guess. Good job nonetheless, this is probably beyond anything I could ever do.

Read full topic

item.title: Old Runescape File Hash Cracker
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:6, topic:423015”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=525677.msg3827447#msg3827447 date=1322291129]

What does this even do?

The old cache file system, in index 0, contained files with hashed names. This reverses that hash into the actual name of the file. I

How is that helpful? We don’t have the files so so what if we have the names? (Not trying to be an ass I’m actually asking)

“so so what” lol

You don’t have to brute the hashes if you ever wanted to get the files? Or if there are files in the cache that aren’t used by the client, you can actually see as to what they are named??
[/quote]

But don’t most clients have the necessary files already?[/quote]

You are missing the point. I actually started this project tonight because I don’t want to have to load the files from a list in order to dump them and would rather just unhash it and then save the file. Its just a helpful code snippet if ever needed.

Read full topic
